raw_response:
```json
[
  {"entry_number": 1, "date": "2025-05-10", "content": "The quiet is so loud today. Eight months. Still feels like yesterday. Tried to read, but my mind just wanders to him, to us."},
  {"entry_number": 2, "date": "2025-05-13", "content": "Made David's favorite stew for dinner. Ate alone. The taste brought back so many memories. It's a bittersweet ache. This loneliness is heavy."},
  {"entry_number": 3, "date": "2025-05-16", "content": "Therapy today. Dr. Evans is patient. Talked about feeling rudderless. How do you find purpose when your compass is gone? It's just hard."},
  {"entry_number": 4, "date": "2025-05-18", "content": "Walked through the park. Saw a couple holding hands, laughing. A pang. I remember our walks. The beauty of spring feels almost cruel without him."},
  {"entry_number": 5, "date": "2025-05-21", "content": "Cleaned out the spare closet. Found his old fishing hat. Held it for a long time. The scent is fading, like everything else. So much grief."},
  {"entry_number": 6, "date": "2025-05-24", "content": "Coffee with Sarah today. She meant well, but her advice felt hollow. Just wanted to talk about David. She misses him too. Or at least, she tries."},
  {"entry_number": 7, "date": "2025-05-27", "content": "A rare good morning. The sun felt warm on my face. Drank tea on the porch. A small moment of peace, fleeting as it was. A tiny shift."},
  {"entry_number": 8, "date": "2025-05-30", "content": "Another therapy session. Discussed small goals. Maybe repotting the hydrangeas. It feels so trivial, but Dr. Evans says it's a start. Purpose, a tiny seed."},
  {"entry_number": 9, "date": "2025-06-02", "content": "Repotted the hydrangeas. My hands were muddy, felt something tangible. Still, the garden bench feels too big for one. Everything is too big."},
  {"entry_number": 10, "date": "2025-06-05", "content": "Visited the library. Just wandered the aisles. Used to come here with David. Now, I just browse the new fiction, trying to escape into stories. Loneliness settles."},
  {"entry_number": 11, "date": "2025-06-08", "content": "A rainy day. Perfect for remembering. Pulled out old photo albums. His smile. My heart aches for those days. Will this pain ever lessen?"},
  {"entry_number": 12, "date": "2025-06-11", "content": "Therapy again. We talked about guilt, about things I wish I'd said. Dr. Evans assured me these feelings are normal. Trying to be kind to myself."},
  {"entry_number": 13, "date": "2025-06-14", "content": "Baked cookies for the first time in ages. The smell filled the house. A comfort, but also a stark reminder of who's not here to share them. Grief's constant companion."},
  {"entry_number": 14, "date": "2025-06-17", "content": "Saw an old student at the grocery store. She remembered me fondly. A fleeting moment of connection. Felt a tiny spark of my old self, the teacher."},
  {"entry_number": 15, "date": "2025-06-20", "content": "Sat on the porch swing. Watched the fireflies. David loved them. These small beauties used to be shared joys. Now, they just highlight his absence. So lonely."},
  {"entry_number": 16, "date": "2025-06-23", "content": "Feeling utterly drained. The simplest tasks feel monumental. Just getting dressed took effort. This wave of exhaustion comes often. Will I ever feel energized again?"},
  {"entry_number": 17, "date": "2025-06-26", "content": "Therapy. Discussed sleep issues. Dr. Evans suggested a regular wind-down routine. Trying to manage the restless nights. The bed feels so empty."},
  {"entry_number": 18, "date": "2025-06-29", "content": "Visited the botanical garden. Beautiful, but I kept wishing David was beside me, pointing out the Latin names. Shared passions are hard to revisit alone. Finding purpose is tough."},
  {"entry_number": 19, "date": "2025-07-02", "content": "Received a card from an old colleague. Just checking in. It was a kind gesture. Nice to know I'm not entirely forgotten, even in my solitude."},
  {"entry_number": 20, "date": "2025-07-05", "content": "Watched an old movie David and I loved. Laughed in places, cried in others. It's a strange comfort, holding onto these shared fragments. Grief is a mosaic."},
  {"entry_number": 21, "date": "2025-07-08", "content": "Tried a new recipe. It wasn't quite right. David always knew just what was missing. Cooking for one lacks the joy of collaboration. A simple meal, a heavy heart."},
  {"entry_number": 22, "date": "2025-07-11", "content": "Therapy focused on self-compassion. I'm so hard on myself for not 'moving on'. Dr. Evans says grief isn't a race. A gentle reminder I needed."},
  {"entry_number": 23, "date": "2025-07-14", "content": "Spent the afternoon sorting through old teaching materials. So many memories of the classroom, of students. A flicker of purpose, perhaps. What good is this knowledge now?"},
  {"entry_number": 24, "date": "2025-07-17", "content": "Called my sister. We talked for an hour. It helped, just hearing a familiar voice, sharing some mundane news. Less lonely for a while."},
  {"entry_number": 25, "date": "2025-07-20", "content": "A bird built a nest outside my window. Watched the parent birds feed their young. Life continues, vibrant and busy. Sometimes I feel so detached from it all."},
  {"entry_number": 26, "date": "2025-07-23", "content": "A tough day. Everything felt grey. The grief just washes over me unexpectedly. No reason, no trigger. Just a profound sense of loss. Loneliness is a cold hand."},
  {"entry_number": 27, "date": "2025-07-26", "content": "Therapy. Discussed the 'grief waves'. Dr. Evans validated the intensity. It helps just to hear someone acknowledge it. Still searching for direction."},
  {"entry_number": 28, "date": "2025-07-29", "content": "Went to the farmer's market. Bought some fresh berries. The vibrant colors were a small lift. David loved fresh produce. Another memory, a quiet smile."},
  {"entry_number": 29, "date": "2025-08-01", "content": "Started reading a new book, a historical novel. Getting lost in a different world is a welcome escape sometimes. A fleeting respite from my own thoughts."},
  {"entry_number": 30, "date": "2025-08-04", "content": "Tried knitting again. It's been years. My stitches are clumsy, but the repetitive motion was soothing. A small project, a focus for my hands. Finding a small purpose."},
  {"entry_number": 31, "date": "2025-08-07", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed how to gradually re-engage with social activities. The idea of group settings feels overwhelming. Still, I know isolation isn't helping."},
  {"entry_number": 32, "date": "2025-08-10", "content": "My niece called. Asked if I could help her with her son's history project. A small request, but it felt good to be asked. A little spark of my old purpose."},
  {"entry_number": 33, "date": "2025-08-13", "content": "Helped my grand-nephew with his history project. Explaining the Magna Carta. Felt a familiar joy in teaching. A brief escape from the loneliness. A good day."},
  {"entry_number": 34, "date": "2025-08-16", "content": "A melancholic afternoon. The house feels emptier after the small burst of activity. The quiet is stark again. This grief is an endless ebb and flow."},
  {"entry_number": 35, "date": "2025-08-19", "content": "Watered David's rose bushes. They're still blooming beautifully. A testament to his care. I try to maintain them as he would have. A small duty, a connection."},
  {"entry_number": 36, "date": "2025-08-22", "content": "Therapy. We explored volunteering options, perhaps at the local historical society. It feels daunting, but the thought of using my skills again is tempting. Maybe a new purpose."},
  {"entry_number": 37, "date": "2025-08-25", "content": "Drove past the old school today. So many years teaching within those walls. A wave of nostalgia. Retirement feels so different now, without David to share it with."},
  {"entry_number": 38, "date": "2025-08-28", "content": "Had tea with an old colleague, Margaret. We talked for hours, mostly about teaching days. It was comforting, remembering the good times. Less lonely than usual."},
  {"entry_number": 39, "date": "2025-08-31", "content": "Applied to volunteer at the historical society. Just filling out the form felt like a small victory. A tentative step towards finding a new rhythm. Hope, maybe?"},
  {"entry_number": 40, "date": "2025-09-03", "content": "Received an email from the historical society. They'd like me to come in for an orientation. A knot of nerves, but also a flicker of excitement. A new direction."},
  {"entry_number": 41, "date": "2025-09-06", "content": "Therapy. Talked about the volunteering. Dr. Evans encouraged me to go, despite the anxiety. Small steps towards purpose. Still, the underlying grief remains."},
  {"entry_number": 42, "date": "2025-09-09", "content": "First day volunteering at the historical society. Met some lovely people. Organized old documents. Felt useful, even if just for a few hours. A new routine forming."},
  {"entry_number": 43, "date": "2025-09-12", "content": "The volunteering felt good today. Shared a coffee break with a woman named Eleanor. We talked about local history. A genuine conversation, not about my grief. A small relief."},
  {"entry_number": 44, "date": "2025-09-15", "content": "A difficult evening. Came home to the quiet house. The sense of accomplishment from volunteering faded. The loneliness returned, sharp and sudden. Grief still lurks."},
  {"entry_number": 45, "date": "2025-09-18", "content": "Therapy. Discussed the ebb and flow of emotions, how good days are followed by tough ones. Dr. Evans says this is normal. Trying to accept it, not fight it."},
  {"entry_number": 46, "date": "2025-09-21", "content": "Spent the day gardening. Pulled weeds, trimmed bushes. It's calming, physical work. My hands know what to do. A quiet purpose in nurturing life."},
  {"entry_number": 47, "date": "2025-09-24", "content": "Volunteering again. Found some fascinating old letters. Lost myself in the stories of the past. It’s a wonderful distraction, giving me a sense of contribution."},
  {"entry_number": 48, "date": "2025-09-27", "content": "Made David's favorite apple pie. It smelled wonderful. Shared a slice with Eleanor from the society. A small act of giving, less lonely than eating alone. Still, memories linger."},
  {"entry_number": 49, "date": "2025-09-30", "content": "A quiet Sunday. Read the paper, drank coffee. A sense of calm, almost. The ache is still there, but it's a dull throb rather than a sharp pain. Progress?"},
  {"entry_number": 50, "date": "2025-10-03", "content": "Therapy. We talked about how finding purpose helps, but doesn't erase grief. It's a parallel journey. Still learning how to carry both. It's a long road."},
  {"entry_number": 51, "date": "2025-10-06", "content": "Went for a drive to see the autumn leaves. The colors are magnificent. David and I used to do this every year. A bittersweet beauty. Remembering him, always."},
  {"entry_number": 52, "date": "2025-10-09", "content": "Helped Eleanor research an old land deed at the society. Felt genuinely engaged. It's good to use my mind, to contribute. My teacher self is resurfacing. Less lonely."},
  {"entry_number": 53, "date": "2025-10-12", "content": "Had a dream about David. So vivid, so real. Woke up feeling his presence, then the crushing realization. It's hard to distinguish dream from reality sometimes. Grief is tricky."},
  {"entry_number": 54, "date": "2025-10-15", "content": "Attended a lecture at the library on local architecture. It was quite interesting. Didn't feel entirely out of place. A small step towards re-engaging with the world."},
  {"entry_number": 55, "date": "2025-10-18", "content": "Therapy today. Discussed how to navigate the upcoming holidays. The first year without him feels impossible. Dr. Evans suggests creating new small traditions, honoring old ones. A challenging task."},
  {"entry_number": 56, "date": "2025-10-21", "content": "Raking leaves in the yard. The crisp air felt good. It's a simple, grounding task. Physical labor helps to clear my head, if only for a little while."},
  {"entry_number": 57, "date": "2025-10-24", "content": "Helped set up an exhibit at the historical society. Felt a sense of accomplishment. Working with others feels more natural now. Less isolated, but still miss David’s commentary."},
  {"entry_number": 58, "date": "2025-10-27", "content": "Had lunch with my sister. We talked about plans for Thanksgiving. Trying to figure out how to navigate the holiday without David's usual cheer. It's going to be difficult."},
  {"entry_number": 59, "date": "2025-10-30", "content": "Picked up some yarn for a new knitting project. A scarf for my grand-nephew. A small act of love and creation. Finding purpose in the small stitches."},
  {"entry_number": 60, "date": "2025-11-02", "content": "Therapy session. Talked about loneliness and how it's different from being alone. I have company sometimes, but the ache for David is unique. A deep void."},
  {"entry_number": 61, "date": "2025-11-05", "content": "Baked a batch of David's favorite pumpkin bread. The smell filled the house with him. A comfort and a sorrow, intertwined. This grief is complex."},
  {"entry_number": 62, "date": "2025-11-08", "content": "A quiet day. Knitted. Read. The rhythm of these days is slowly becoming my own. Still, moments of profound sadness pierce through. A constant reminder of absence."},
  {"entry_number": 63, "date": "2025-11-11", "content": "Volunteering felt purposeful today. Helped a student with a research project. The familiar joy of guiding someone, of sharing knowledge. My teacher heart stirs."},
  {"entry_number": 64, "date": "2025-11-14", "content": "Visited David's grave. Brought him some fresh flowers. Talked to him, told him about my days. It felt good, a private moment of connection. Still hurts so much."},
  {"entry_number": 65, "date": "2025-11-17", "content": "Therapy. Discussed coping strategies for Thanksgiving. Dr. Evans emphasized being gentle with myself. No pressure to be cheerful. Just to be present, whatever that means."},
  {"entry_number": 66, "date": "2025-11-20", "content": "Tried to plan a small meal for Thanksgiving. Just my sister and her family. It's not the same without David's booming laughter. A quiet holiday approaches."},
  {"entry_number": 67, "date": "2025-11-23", "content": "Went grocery shopping for Thanksgiving. Saw families bustling together. A wave of loneliness washed over me. The holidays amplify absence. It's an undeniable truth."},
  {"entry_number": 68, "date": "2025-11-26", "content": "Thanksgiving was quiet. My sister's family was kind. We talked about David, shared a few stories. It was hard, but also comforting to honor his memory. A bittersweet day."},
  {"entry_number": 69, "date": "2025-11-29", "content": "Feeling utterly drained after the holiday. The emotional toll is immense. Just want to curl up and sleep. This grief exhausts me completely. Will I ever feel rested?"},
  {"entry_number": 70, "date": "2025-12-02", "content": "Therapy. Talked about the exhaustion and the raw emotion of Thanksgiving. Dr. Evans reassured me it's normal. Focused on self-care for the upcoming Christmas season. It feels insurmountable."},
  {"entry_number": 71, "date": "2025-12-05", "content": "Started decorating the house, just a little. A small tree, some lights. David loved Christmas. It feels strange, doing it alone. A tribute, perhaps, to him."},
  {"entry_number": 72, "date": "2025-12-08", "content": "Volunteering today felt like a needed distraction. Helped catalogue some old photographs. Lost myself in the faces of the past. A temporary escape from my own present."},
  {"entry_number": 73, "date": "2025-12-11", "content": "Received Christmas cards. So many addressed to 'Mr. and Mrs. Quinn'. A sharp reminder. The world hasn't quite caught up to my new reality. Still, kindness is appreciated."},
  {"entry_number": 74, "date": "2025-12-14", "content": "Went to a small Christmas concert. Eleanor from the society invited me. It was lovely, the music calming. Small steps out of my shell. Less lonely for an hour."},
  {"entry_number": 75, "date": "2025-12-17", "content": "Therapy. Discussed the balance between honoring old traditions and creating new ones. It's a delicate dance. Trying to find joy without guilt. Grief is a constant companion."},
  {"entry_number": 76, "date": "2025-12-20", "content": "Bought a small gift for David's favorite charity. A new tradition. It felt good to give in his name, a way to keep his spirit alive. Finding purpose in giving."},
  {"entry_number": 77, "date": "2025-12-23", "content": "Christmas Eve. The quiet is profound. Lit a candle for David. Remembering all our Christmases together. The pain is sharp, but so is the love. A night of reflection."},
  {"entry_number": 78, "date": "2025-12-26", "content": "Christmas Day was bittersweet. Spent it with my sister's family. Missed David terribly, his boisterous presence. But also felt a fragile warmth from family. Enduring, somehow."},
  {"entry_number": 79, "date": "2025-12-29", "content": "Reflecting on the year almost past. So much pain, so much loss. But also small moments of connection, glimpses of purpose. A year of immense change. Grief transforms."},
  {"entry_number": 80, "date": "2026-01-01", "content": "New Year's Day. The world feels hopeful, but I still feel stuck. David would always make resolutions. Mine? To just keep going. To find my footing again. Finding purpose, inch by inch."},
  {"entry_number": 81, "date": "2026-01-04", "content": "Therapy today. We talked about starting a new year. Acknowledged the weight of the past year. Dr. Evans encouraged setting small, achievable intentions, not grand resolutions. Gently moving forward."},
  {"entry_number": 82, "date": "2026-01-07", "content": "Cleaned out the pantry. Donated some unused items. A small act of decluttering, clearing space. Physically and perhaps, metaphorically. It felt good to simplify."},
  {"entry_number": 83, "date": "2026-01-10", "content": "Volunteering at the historical society. Helped prepare for a school visit. Felt useful, even important. The children's curiosity was infectious. My teacher heart truly enjoyed it."},
  {"entry_number": 84, "date": "2026-01-13", "content": "A cold, grey day. Stayed in, read a book. The quiet felt less oppressive today, more peaceful. Perhaps I'm growing more comfortable in my own company. Less lonely, maybe."},
  {"entry_number": 85, "date": "2026-01-16", "content": "David's birthday today. Baked a small cake. Sang "Happy Birthday" to his photo. It was painful, but also a beautiful ritual. Remembering him with love, always. Grief takes many forms."},
  {"entry_number": 86, "date": "2026-01-19", "content": "Therapy. Discussed David's birthday. Dr. Evans validated the mix of pain and love. It's okay for joy and sorrow to coexist. A gentle reminder to embrace it all."},
  {"entry_number": 87, "date": "2026-01-22", "content": "Called a former colleague, Sarah, whom I haven't spoken to in years. We had a lovely chat. Making connections, slowly reaching out. Less isolated, one conversation at a time."},
  {"entry_number": 88, "date": "2026-01-25", "content": "Went to a matinee movie with Eleanor. A lighthearted comedy. It felt good to laugh, a genuine, unburdened laugh. A real breakthrough, a moment of unadulterated joy."},
  {"entry_number": 89, "date": "2026-01-28", "content": "The house felt lighter today. Maybe it's the bit of sunshine, or maybe it's me. A quiet sense of contentment, fleeting but present. Slowly, slowly, healing."},
  {"entry_number": 90, "date": "2026-01-31", "content": "Received an invitation to join a book club. Eleanor suggested it. It feels like a big step, a real commitment. Thinking about it, cautiously hopeful. New purpose?"},
  {"entry_number": 91, "date": "2026-02-03", "content": "Therapy. Talked about the book club invitation. Dr. Evans encouraged me to go. Acknowledged the fear, but also the potential for connection. A step towards new social circles."},
  {"entry_number": 92, "date": "2026-02-06", "content": "Went to the first book club meeting. Everyone was so welcoming. Discussed a lovely novel. Felt engaged, part of something. A wonderful feeling. Less lonely, truly."},
  {"entry_number": 93, "date": "2026-02-09", "content": "My grand-niece visited. We baked cookies together. Her youthful energy is infectious. A reminder of the joy of family, of generations continuing. A sweet, happy day."},
  {"entry_number": 94, "date": "2026-02-12", "content": "Volunteering. Proposed a small project to digitize some local historical photos. My old organizational skills coming to the fore. A real sense of purpose blooming."},
  {"entry_number": 95, "date": "2026-02-15", "content": "Valentine's Day. It was hard. David always made it special. But I remembered his love, carried it in my heart. A quiet strength in remembrance. Grief is love's shadow."},
  {"entry_number": 96, "date": "2026-02-18", "content": "Therapy today. Reflected on Valentine's Day. Dr. Evans noted my resilience. Acknowledged how far I've come. The grief is still there, but I'm learning to live alongside it."},
  {"entry_number": 97, "date": "2026-02-21", "content": "The historical society approved my digitization project! I'm excited. It feels good to have a project, something to pour my energy into. A real sense of purpose."},
  {"entry_number": 98, "date": "2026-02-24", "content": "Spent the day planning the digitization project. My teacher mind is buzzing with ideas. This feels like a true calling, a new chapter beginning. A hopeful future."},
  {"entry_number": 99, "date": "2026-02-27", "content": "Had coffee with Eleanor. She's becoming a good friend. We talked about the project, about life. Real connection, deep conversations. The loneliness has lessened, genuinely."},
  {"entry_number": 100, "date": "2026-03-02", "content": "A beautiful spring morning. The grief is still a part of me, a quiet hum. But I also feel a strength, a purpose, a quiet hope. Life continues, and so do I. "}
]
```
